name: Palindrome check
description: Check whether a given string is a palindrome (reads the same forwards and backwards).

input_output.output_description: true if the string is a palindrome, false otherwise.

steps: Convert the string to a normalized form (e.g. lowercase).
Use two indexes: one starting at the beginning, one at the end.
Move both indexes towards the center, comparing characters.
If any pair does not match, the string is not a palindrome.
If all pairs match, the string is a palindrome.

explanation.title: Normalization
explanation.text: The string is converted to lowercase so that 'L' and 'l' are treated as equal.

explanation.title: Two-pointer technique
explanation.text: We compare characters from the start and end moving towards the center. If all pairs match, the string is a palindrome.

explanation.title: Complexity
explanation.text: The algorithm runs in O(n) time where n is the length of the string.

variations: Ignore spaces and punctuation before checking.
Make the function return the first mismatching index for debugging.
